page.title: 15 Great Missenden Church
page.content: The first church was built in 1200 on land which belonged to the Abbey next door.The present building dates back to the fourteenth and fifteenth centuries, but half of it was built less than a hundred years ago. The church has quite a few connections with the Civil War:a vicar called Robert Lenthall who was a relation of the Speaker in the House of Commons in Cromwell's time,and a Mr.Penn who founded Pennsylvania. There was an artist from the last century called William Kennal. Most people who worship here now live fairly locally.There are three youth clubs,a Wednesday club for 10-12 year olds,A.C.T.on Saturdays for 12-16 year olds and S.A.C.T. on Sundays.The Sunday Joint hold a Young People's Service each week after the morning Parish Communion Service.
